baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is there an underlying offense with its own offense guideline that applies to this case?

yesResult.description: Use the offense level from the applicable underlying offense guideline

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve two or more participants?

yesResult.description: Offense involved two or more participants

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve either (A) the use or threat of force against a person, or (B) property damage or the threat of property damage?

yesResult.description: Offense involved use/threat of force against person or property damage/threat of property damage

noResult.description: Base level for all other offenses under this guideline

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant a public official at the time of the offense, or was the offense committed under color of law?

yesEffect.description: Defendant was a public official or offense was committed under color of law

2H3.1.title: Interception of Communications; Eavesdropping; Disclosure of Certain

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the obstruction occur by use of force or threat of force against person(s) or property?

yesResult.description: Obstruction by force or threat of force

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the defendant solicit, demand, accept, or agree to accept anything of value to vote, refrain from voting, vote for or against a particular candidate, or register to vote?
Did the defendant give false information to establish eligibility to vote?
Did the defendant vote more than once in a federal election?

noResult.description: Obstruction by forgery, fraud, theft, bribery, deceit, or other means

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Does the defendant fall under 18 U.S.C. § 1039(d) or (e), OR was the purpose to obtain direct or indirect commercial advantage or economic gain?

yesEffect.description: Conviction under 18 U.S.C. § 1039(d) or (e), or purpose was commercial advantage/economic gain

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Is the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 119?

options.label: Convicted under § 119 AND offense involved use of computer/interactive computer service to make restricted personal information about covered person publicly available

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the offense of obstructing correspondence committed for pecuniary gain?

yesResult.description: Base level 6 plus 3-level increase for pecuniary gain

noResult.description: Base offense level for obstructing correspondence

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the offense committed for pecuniary gain?

2H4.1.title: Peonage, Involuntary Servitude, Slave Trade, and Child Soldiers

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the defendant convicted of an offense under 18 U.S.C. § 1592?
Was the defendant convicted of an offense under 18 U.S.C. § 1593A based on an act in violation of 18 U.S.C. § 1592?

yesResult.description: Conviction under 18 U.S.C. § 1593A based on violation of § 1592

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: What level of bodily injury did any victim sustain?
What was the extent of dangerous weapon involvement?

options.label: Dangerous weapon was brandished or use was threatened

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: How long was any victim held in a condition of peonage or involuntary servitude?

2H4.2.title: Willful Violations of the Migrant and Seasonal Agricultural Worker Protection

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Does this offense have a base offense level of 6?

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve bodily injury?
Did the defendant commit any part of the instant offense subsequent to sustaining a civil or administrative adjudication for similar misconduct?

yesEffect.description: Offense committed after civil or administrative adjudication for similar misconduct
